definition: to put together/to make up (a set)/to round up (a number to a convenient multiple)/resulting in...
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.chinese: 加上這一件就湊成全套了。

sentences.english: He planned to tag old articles together to make a book.
sentences.chinese: 他計劃把舊文章湊成一本書。

sentences.english: I want one more stamp to complete my set.
sentences.chinese: 我再有一枚郵票就湊成一套了。

sentences.english: We're still ten men shy of a full class.
sentences.chinese: 我們還差十個人才能湊成一個班。

sentences.english: You need to match three cards of the same suit.
sentences.chinese: 你需要用三張同花色的牌湊成一副。

sentences.english: We need to rake up two more players to form a team.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要物色兩名隊員才能湊成一個隊。

sentences.english: The vet had improvised a harness.
sentences.chinese: 獸醫臨時湊成了一副馬具。

sentences.english: I need one more stamp to complete my collection.
sentences.chinese: 我所收集的郵票還差一張才湊成整套。
